Wisdom: إِخْوَانُ الدُّنْيَا [الْإِخْوَانُ فِي الدُّنْيَا] تَنْقَطِعُ مَوَدَّتُهُمْ [موداتهم‏] لِسُرْعَةِ انْقِطَاعِ أَسْبَابِهَا
enWisdom: Worldly brothers are such that their affection is cut off as quickly as its causes are severed

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمُصَادَقَةَ الْبَخِيلِ [الْبُخْلِ‏] فَإِنَّهُ يَقْعُدُ عَنْكَ أَحْوَجَ مَا تَكُونُ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Be careful not to befriend a miser, for he will hold back [from assisting you] when you are most in need of him

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمُصَادَقَةَ الْكَذَّابِ فَإِنَّهُ يُقَرِّبُ عَلَيْكَ الْبَعِيدَ وَيُبَعِّدُ عَلَيْكَ الْقَرِيبَ
enWisdom: The brotherhood of the righteous is to be considered beneficial whereas association with the wicked and sinful is to be avoided

Wisdom: أَحَقُّ النَّاسِ أَنْ يُحْذَرَ السُّلْطَانُ الْجَائِرُ وَالْعَدُوُّ الْقَادِرُ وَالصَّدِيقُ الْغَادِرُ
enWisdom: The people whom one should be cautious of the most are the tyrannical king, the powerful enemy and the disloyal friend

Wisdom: بِئْسَ الرَّفِيقُ الْحَسُودُ
enWisdom: How evil a comrade the envious one is!

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لَكَ بِأَخٍ مَنِ احْتَجْتَ إِلَى مُدَارَاتِهِ
enWisdom: He whom you need to indulge is not your [true] brother

Wisdom: لَيْسَ بِرَفِيقٍ مَحْمُودٍ مَنْ أَحْوَجَ صَاحِبَهُ إِلَى مُمَارَاتِهِ
enWisdom: He who forces his companion to argue with him is not a comrade with praiseworthy traits

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لَكَ بِأَخٍ مَنْ أَحْوَجَكَ إِلَى حَاكِمٍ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَهُ
enWisdom: He who forces his companion to argue with him is not a comrade with praiseworthy traits

Wisdom: مَنْ وَادَّ [وَدَّ] السَّخِيفَ أَعْرَبَ عَنْ سَخَفِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever befriends a silly person proclaims his own silliness

Wisdom: مَنْ وَادَّكَ لِأَمْرٍ وَلَّى عِنْدَ انْقِضَائِهِ
enWisdom: One who befriends you for a [specific] objective, turns his back [on you] once it is accomplished

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُحْسِنْ خُلُقَهُ لَمْ يَنْتَفِعْ بِهِ قَرِينُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever does not make his character good, his companion will not benefit from him

Wisdom: مَنْ دَنَتْ هِمَّتُهُ فَلَا تَصْحَبْهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks a truly loyal friend, seeks that which cannot be found

Wisdom: مِنْ أَعْظَمِ الْحُمْقِ مُؤَاخَاةُ الْفُجَّارِ
enWisdom: Establishing brotherhood with the vicious is from the greatest [acts of] foolishness

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبَنَّ مَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ
enWisdom: Do not give preference to an ignoble person over a noble one

Wisdom: لَا تَمْنَحَنَّ وُدَّكَ مَنْ لَا وَفَاءَ لَهُ
enWisdom: Do not grant your friendship to one who has no loyalty

Wisdom: لَا تَرْغَبَنَّ فِي مَوَدَّةِ مَنْ لَمْ تَكْشِفْهُ
enWisdom: Do not be keen in befriending a person whose true nature you have not known

Wisdom: لَا تَعْتَمِدْ عَلَى مَوَدَّةِ مَنْ لَا يُوفِي بِعَهْدِهِ
enWisdom: Do not rely on the friendship of the one who does not fulfil his promise

Wisdom: لَا تَعُدَّنَّ صَدِيقاً مَنْ لَا يُوَاسِي بِمَالِهِ
enWisdom: Do not count one who does not support [you] with his wealth as a friend

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبْ مَنْ يَحْفَظُ مَسَاوِيَكُ وَيَنْسَى فَضَائِلَكَ وَمَعَالِيَكَ
enWisdom: Do not accompany anyone but the intelligent and pious; and do not associate with anyone but the knowledgeable and righteous; and do not mention your secret to anyone but the trustworthy and loyal

Wisdom: لَا تُوَاخِ مَنْ يَسْتُرُ مَنَاقِبَكَ وَيَنْشُرُ مَثَالِبَكَ
enWisdom: Do not take as a brother one who hides your positive traits and exposes your shortcomings

Wisdom: لَا تَطْلُبَنَّ الْإِخَاءَ عِنْدَ أَهْلِ الْجَفَاءِ وَاطْلُبْهُ عِنْدَ أَهْلِ الْحِفَاظِ وَالْوَفَاءِ
enWisdom: Do not seek brotherhood [and friendship] among the uncouth people, rather seek it among the trustworthy and loyal people

Wisdom: لَا يُغْتَبَطُ بِمَوَدَّةِ مَنْ لَا دِينَ لَهُ
enWisdom: The friendship of one who has no faith is not something to be envious about

Wisdom: بِئْسَ الصَّدِيقُ الْمَلُولُ
enWisdom: The worst friend is the one who is [easily] fed up

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِمَلُولٍ إِخَاءٌ
enWisdom: One who is fed-up has no [sense of] brotherhood

Wisdom: لَا أُخُوَّةَ لِمَلُولٍ
enWisdom: There is no brotherhood for the one who is fed-up

Wisdom: لَا خُلَّةَ لِمَلُولٍ
enWisdom: There is no friendship for the one who is fed-up
